answers.answer: Her contractions have been 10 minutes apart. But they go away after a few hours. She's mainly getting them at night now, which kinds makes me think this will be a "middle of the night" baby. Also, the baby isn't moving much anymore, which the doc said is a good sign that it's coming soon.She walked around yesterday at Costco. And then she went for a short walk with our other sister last night.I'm in Arizona. The hospitals here won't admit you until you're 5 cm.I didn't know you could lose the mucous plug that far before delivering. She won't be happy to hear that! ha ha!
Her contractions do not seem productive. They may have to induce her if it last much longer. Tell her to walk and eat spicy foods!

I lost my mucous plug a week before Superbowl and I was induced on February 22nd.... I was under the misconception that once the mucous plug goes, its quick.  it can take a while.  I also had contractions for weeks, but they werent regular.  I know how miserable that 9th month can be with waiting for the baby... I hope she goes soon.
oh maybe a halloween baby! we couldnt tell ya but i doubt it will be too much longer. are her contractions getting any certain time down? is she nauseated?

Im due tomorrow and have lost my mucus plug but Im scheduled to be induced on Monday morning.  Losing the mucus plug doesnt really affect the pregnancy ...you can lose it weeks before you go into labor.  Walking helps!

well when i had my baby also my first i walked around 2 weeks 4-5 cm dilated and the loss of my mucus plug and my baby come on my due date that my 32wk ultrasound gave me! So datz not a real indication of when labor will occur, its soo hard but she will just have to ride it out, a baby will be here soon enough!

Wow, I'm so sorry you're having to stress out about all this now. I hope everything is okay. How did the ultrasound go? Good luck! I don't think they'll let my sis go past her due date because she has gestational diabetes. So hopefully it will be soon!!!

Keep us posted on how your sisters doing. The Dr shouldnt let her go over since she has GD. I havent had any problems so far so I think thats why my dr is letting me go over my due date...but being super cautious.  The u/s sucked...the tech wouldnt let me see the screen and didnt really tell me what was going on.  I have another one on Thursday, hopefully with a different tech!!!

Also since todays my due date and the baby dont move so much I had to have a fetal stress test and u/s done yesterdsay and then go back on Thursday.  They want to make sure his heartbeat is good, he can breath on his own, all his organs are the right size, the umbilical cord is not wrapped around him, etc.
I am 36 weeks and 4days and dilated to 3and 90% effaced when should my baby be here

question: My sister has already passed the mucous plug, the baby is pretty much in the cervix now, and she's 1 cm dilated (which she has been for about 3 weeks). She's been having hard contractions on and off for 2 days, and she's unble to sleep at all. Her due date isn't until the 12th, but this is her first, and we're just wondering...how much longer is it really? It seems like she will have the baby any minute now, but could it still be a week away?
title: How much longer till the baby's born?
